# inputing data from forked github
```{r}
cat_lovers <- read.csv("https://raw.githubusercontent.com/miaamato/tidyverse/main/cat-lovers.csv")
cat_lovers
```
# renaming the column i..name
```{r}
library(tidyverse)
names(cat_lovers)[names(cat_lovers) == "Ã¯..name"] <- "name"
cat_lovers
```


# need to open dplyr to use %>%
```{r}
library(dplyr)
cat_lovers %>%
  summarize(mean_cats = mean(number_of_cats))

```
```{r}
cat_lovers %>%
  summarize(mean_cats = mean(number_of_cats, na.rm = TRUE))
```

# fixing dataset
```{r}
cat_lovers %>%
  mutate(number_of_cats = case_when(
    name == "Ginger Clark" ~ 2,
    name == "Doug Bass"    ~ 3,
    TRUE                   ~ as.numeric(number_of_cats)
    )) %>%
  summarise(mean_cats = mean(number_of_cats))
```
```{r}
cat_lovers <- cat_lovers %>%
  mutate(
    number_of_cats = case_when(
      name == "Ginger Clark" ~ "2",
      name == "Doug Bass"    ~ "3",
      TRUE                   ~ number_of_cats
      ),
    number_of_cats = as.numeric(number_of_cats)
    )
```


# logical, double, integer,character
# integers are indicated w an L
# integer -> logical -> double
# double -> character
```{r}
typeof(TRUE)
typeof("hello")
typeof(55)
typeof(1:3)
typeof(4L)
```
# Vectors
```{r}
c(1,2,3,3)
hellos <- c("Hello", "World!")
hellos
greet <- c(c("hi", "hey"), c("jello", "hello"))
greet
```
#explicit coercion
Number vs Character
```{r}
x <- c(1:3)
typeof(x)
typeof(as.character(x))
```
Number vs Logical
```{r}
x <-c("TRUE", "FALSE")
typeof(as.numeric(x))
```
# implicit coercion

```{r}
typeof(c(1, FALSE))
typeof(c("hello", 1))

```
